title: Balakliia
text:
Balakliia or Balakleya (, , <a href="Romanization%20of%20Russian">translit.</a> "Balakleya") is a <a href="city">city</a> in <a href="Izium%20Raion">Izium Raion</a>, <a href="Kharkiv%20Oblast">Kharkiv Oblast</a> (<a href="Oblast">province</a>) of eastern <a href="Ukraine">Ukraine</a>. It is an important railroad junction in the oblast. Balakliia hosts the administration of <a href="Balakliia%20urban%20hromada">Balakliia urban hromada</a>, one of the <a href="hromada">hromada</a>s of Ukraine. Population: 
Until 18 July 2020, Balakliia was the administrative center of <a href="Balakliia%20Raion">Balakliia Raion</a>. The raion was abolished in July 2020 as part of the administrative reform of Ukraine, which reduced the number of raions of Kharkiv Oblast to seven. The area of Balakliia Raion was merged into Izium Raion.
2017 explosions.
On 23 March 2017, 20,000 inhabitants of Balakliia were evacuated after a series of massive explosions erupted at a nearby arms depot of the Balakliya military installation, which stockpiles missile and artillery ammunition. The disaster led to one civilian woman killed and five others injured (with no casualties among the military). Thousands of residents within a 10 km radius around the complex were evacuated in the aftermath. By the end of March, the fires and resulting arms explosions at the ammunition depot in Balakliia had damaged almost 250 buildings. On 18 April (2017) the city and nearby villages were declared cleared from unexploded <a href="wiktionary%3Aordnance">ordnance</a>.
On 3 May 2018 ignition of dry grass lead to a new series of explosions at the depot. But this time without military or civilian casualties; but 1,500 locals were evacuated.
